title: How to Stop a Mean Girl Bully

steps.title: Do your best to ignore the mean girl.
steps.content: Do your best to ignore the mean girl. [1] X Research source Bullies crave attention, and mean girls are no different. If she expects a reaction and you don’t give her one, she may get bored and stop bothering you.

steps.title: It's important to get help from an adult.
steps.content: It's important to get help from an adult. Whether it’s a teacher, counselor, or parent, talking to someone can help address the problem. [2] X Research source Make sure you tell them not to mention your name so you aren’t labeled a snitch. By doing so, not only will you get your problem out, but you'll also be getting it off your chest, and sharing it with someone who cares.

steps.title: Eye contact shows confidence, that you couldn't care less what she does.
steps.content: Eye contact shows confidence, that you couldn't care less what she does. If she can sense you're 'weak' or scared, she'll go after that. When you're making eye contact, and she looks at you, just give your hair a flick, smile, and turn away.

steps.title: It's best to stay away from any physical fighting.
steps.content: It's best to stay away from any physical fighting. [3] X Research source However, if you are being physically threatened, (with guns, knives, etc.) do whatever you can. Do NOT start a fight or a riot; it will only create tension, and an audience, which may lead to a principal or boss pulling you into their office for a talk.

steps.title: This is the key to making her stop.
steps.content: This is the key to making her stop. Make her feel bad about bullying and try to shut her up so that she can't bother you. In other words, say something that she can't answer. Nevertheless, make sure it's not something that she can later make a comeback from. Showing her assertive energy can also help, in some cases; it doesn't need to be confrontational. [4] X Research source If she feels the need to say "we" or "us" and you know it's only her that's bullying you, it shows that she's a coward, and she is trying to intimidate you. They do that to make people scared.

steps.title: It may feel overwhelming, but bullying is temporary.
steps.content: It may feel overwhelming, but bullying is temporary. You will not have to deal with this person forever.

steps.title: Is it only you she's bullying?
steps.content: Is it only you she's bullying? Maybe she has other victims too. Talk to them about it; see if she is doing the exact same thing to others.

steps.title: Hard kidding, making you the butt of the joke all the time, put-downs, and harsh criticism for no reason can't slide.
steps.content: Hard kidding, making you the butt of the joke all the time, put-downs, and harsh criticism for no reason can't slide. If it's been going on for months or longer, it's a red flag. If it's a friend that's doing this, your friend is slowly wearing you down and that's indirect aggression.

steps.title: Don't try to butter up to her.
steps.content: Don't try to butter up to her. That’s weakness in her eyes and don't provoke anything. (Your talents provoke her already.) [5] X Research source

steps.title: Avoid gossiping or talking badly about her in return.
steps.content: Avoid gossiping or talking badly about her in return. Negative reactions will only fuel the cycle of bullying.
